arm_group.description: Indigo Carmine (2 mg per kilo) and 2nd half of PEG dose will be orally administered to patients prior to  colonoscopy.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to examine whether oral administration of Indigo Carmine
      together with  Polyethylene Glycol (PEG), the usual  colon preparatory solution, can be used
      instead of staining during the examination itself.

clinical_study.brief_title: Chromoendoscopy of the Colon After Oral Administration of Indigo Carmine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients suffering from Inflammatory Bowel Disease

          -  Patients under surveillance for Disease-Associated Lesions and Masses (DALM)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  All others

intervention.description: Oral administration of Indigo Carmine prior to colonoscopy

primary_outcome.description: The efficacy of Indigo Carmine in staining tissues to better characterize, delineate, and highlight the gastrointestinal mucosa will be determined during the colonoscopic examination.  Biopsies will be taken from suspicious lesions.
primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of Indigo Carmine during oral administration

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
